author: Special Correspondent
text:
Re-laying of roads damaged over the years due to laying of underground pipelines, and construction of storm-water drains and minor bridges in the city limits was initiated on Friday with Rs. 86.53 crore sanctioned recently by the State Government.

A total of 48 road works in all the four zones of the Corporation to a cumulative length of a little over 100 km are to be undertaken in the coming months.

Environment Minister Thoppu N.D. Venkatachalam took part in the bhoomi puja for start of the work along with District Collector S. Prabakar, Mayor Malliga Paramasivam, Deputy Mayor K.C. Palanichamy and many other dignitaries.

The puja was conducted at 10 locations including Kumalankuttai, Soorampatti, Bus Stand, Molapalayam, Theeran Chnnamalai Street, Netaji Nagar, Eashwaran Kovil-Thiruvnkatasamy Kovil street junction, Karunkalpalayam police station road, and Sriram Nagar.
title: Work on re-laying damaged roads commences in Erode
